name: La Flora Resort Patong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel is a HUGE rip off. They market themselves as a oasis of calm and relaxation just moments away from the crazy city life of patong-- correction-- THEY ARE SMACK IN THE MIDDLE OF IT! Literally, the hotel is sandwiched between a McDonalds and a Starbucks with massage parlors and kiosks practically hanging out on the front steps. There is no gate..no security...no nothing. ZERO sense of privacy from the chaos of Patong. The rooms were halfway decent but not worth the cost of the hotel, especially when the US dollar goes as far as it does in Thailand. The noise was unbearable--firecrackers going off every hour on the hour in the middle of the night, paper thin walls where you could hear everyone's everything...and not to mention, the Thai national anthem blaring loudly in our ears at 8AM on the dot (this was broadcast from the hotel!) The "private beach" they preach about does not exist. They do not provide beach chairs or anything to do with the beach besides access to it--yes the hotel is on the beach but two steps off the property and we were greeted by a mob scene. We had to rent chairs for 200 baht and the beach was filthy. Gone were the pristine blue waters we had dreamt about--instead we witnessed a murky green grossness. It was awful. The food? TERRIBLE. I've never been so disgusted by a breakfast buffet at what was supposed to be a 5 star resort. Everything looked like it had been sitting outside for hours... there was barely any fresh fruit and the continental fare they prepared was abhorrent--also, barely anyone spoke english so it was impossible to get anything done correctly. Aside from all of these grievances there were two other issues I thought I would share with the Trip Advisor community-- after we complained to the management about the noise as well as a host of other things that had gone wrong with our room and our planned stay, we were upgraded to a suite in the hotel with a private pool. This would have made up for everything had the following not happened. My friend, whom I was traveling and staying with, almost cut his foot on a large shard of broken glass that was left carelessly in the bottom of our private pool. Apparently, a previous guest had broken the window and when the hotel repaired it, they clearly had forgotten to clean up the remains. IT WAS ABSURD. One of us could have easily cut open our foot on it and sued the hotel. Luckily we found it in time but that kind of negligence is frightening at an SLH 5 star hotel and when we brought it up to management, they did nothing. Lastly, it was our final day at the hotel and we had invited three of our friends to come by and have drinks by the pool. Please note that at the time we had invited our friends over the pool was practically empty. It was us and one man who was chain smoking cigarettes. Our friends arrived and the manager walks up to us and tells us that we are NOT ALLOWED TO HAVE FRIENDS AT THE POOL. They should leave immediately as the pool is only available for hotel guests. THERE WAS NO ONE AT THE POOL. Well that was the straw that broke the camels back. It was so embarrassing, so unnecessary and so ridiculous. We were shocked. I felt like had been a part of thailand scam where I thought I was getting one thing and instead got something very very different. If you want a gorgeous, relaxing experience with a private beach and real 5-star amenities that's near Patong but not IN IT, try Le Meridien. DO NOT BE FOOLED!
reviews.title: DON'T BE FOOLED!! SCAM!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: **one other thing** it should be noted that we complained about our stay to our SLH representatives and received money back from the hotel which was much appreciated. However, that being said, it was an extraordinarily difficult process that took weeks. It was the biggest disappointment of our vacation to Thailand.
reviews.title: Best beach front hotel in Patong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013
reviews.text: Stayed here on numerous occasions since it opened. Great boutique hotel, right on the beach. Best beach hotel in Patong, no road to cross. Oasis in the hustle and bustle of Patong but easy to get out into town. Restaurant not that great. Staff very friendly. Roof top bar great for pre dinner cocktails with a bunch of friends (but lonely if you go on your own!). Pricier than most in Patong.
reviews.title: Great location but the room below my expectation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Great hotel to relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - location
reviews.title: Amazing stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We went to this hotel, moving from the Le Meridien Brach Resort, because it wasn´t a 5 star hotel and they have problems with security staff.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Flora is a charming hotel in Patong Beach, with access to the beach, but it is a aosis in the town. Rooms are wide and extremelly warm fursnished. We had a villa with its own swiming pool.Incredible!!!!
reviews.title: It could be a nice resort, if….

likes.disliked: — Bad Smell from sewage and kitchen

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great food, wonderful bar overlooking the beach, nice swiming pools,and fantastic and friendly staff.
reviews.title: An oasis in a not so nice town

likes.disliked: — the town where it is located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I reccomemended it!!!
reviews.title: when can we return!

likes.disliked: — think some sort of local car service should be provided like other hotels do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I just stay in La Flora Patong one month ago. My first impression is that Tripadvisor good comments are very far of reality. Instead of one the best hotel in Patong, we found a “look like” luxury concrete resort next to Mac Donald, including its fat smells and those from toilets without sewage. In addition, I don’t speak about the permanent heavy noise of the traffic jam, the main street being 2 meters only from the lobby. The staff is very kind but non professional and don’t understand either speak english which is non acceptable for a 5 star hotel. However, the room design is very trendy and the buffet breakfast is excellent.
reviews.title: Thoughtfully designed

likes.liked: — The contemporary design of the resort and rooms. The proximity to shopping and beach. The comfy bed and great showers. The TV & DVD player. The free Wifi.
likes.disliked: — The front desk service. Could more friendly and personal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in October, 2 nights in a Pool Villa and 3 nights in a pool access room. When we arrived our villa was not ready although it was early in the morning the previous guests had not checked out yet. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we had full use of facilities until the room was ready.
reviews.title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is pefect, right on the beach and near Bangla Rd Bars and restaurants. We did not eat at the restaurant although the buffet breakfast was good and included in our room rate. We also received complimentary mini bar daily.
reviews.title: loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rootop bar, spa and fitness centre were not ready although were only days away. Overall a great resort.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

likes.liked: — Small touches that add to the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed at la flora for 5 nights on aug 2008. we booked 2 nights at first as we thought of tryin another hotel the remaining nights we'll be there. but somehow ended extending our stay instead. we fell in love with the room the min we stepped in. it was comfy and well decorated. we love love love the free mini bar and so as the selected aromatheraphy scent the maid would burn up in the room every evening.
reviews.title: We loved La Flora!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the hotel is situated right in the heart of patong. its very convenience as you can be as close to the shopping area and the beach at the same time. another thing to love is that the maid clean up ur room twice a day. so it would be nice to have a clean room to sleep in after da mess we mite bring from the beach sand in the evening.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Great Location and Beautiful Accommodation

likes.liked: — The location was so close to everything yet you could escape it all

reviews.title: Excellent location vey nice hotel
reviews.text: We usually stay a few metres up the road at the Impiana but thought we would give this one a go as it also fronts onto the beach. Rooms are very nice, well appointed and they have a free mini bar! The two pools are nice and the day beds very comfortable although there dont appear to be many of them so not sure what high season would be like. Not a huge hotel so has a more intimate feel than what you get with the larger chains. Staff are friendly. Would come back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 weeks in a beach front pool villa ,all I can say is OMG,from when we arrived to when we were waiting for our car to take us to the airport the staff there were outstanding,so friendly,the room was absolutely beautiful and kept lovely and clean every day by the house keeping staff.they treated us like royalty and a great big thank you guys ,we have decided we are going back next year and taking our family and friends.
reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary here and we absolutely love La Flora. Direct beach access, no roads to cross, amazing staff, great roof top bar, awesome location. Will be back for sure. Thanks to staff and management for making our stay so memorable,
reviews.title: WOW!! A real GEM!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: Although the design of the hotel is very trendy, it deserves some minor repairs.
reviews.title: decent 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location is very convinent both to the beach and all you might require in Patong.
reviews.title: only one complaint
Very nice hotel in patong
reviews.text: I can find something to complain if i want to but i wont do that..its a good hotel at the heart of patong beach..everything was perfect except the rates but if a good hotel in patong worth this then its a deal..i recommend this hotel to everyone who can afford

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at La Flora to celebrate my 50th birthday in style. From the moment I arrived to the moment I left, the staff was incredibly kind, helpful and friendly. Every time I saw a staff member, I was greeted by name. They even brought me a cake and sang Happy Birthday.
reviews.title: Absolutely amazing . . . worth every penny!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: The resort itself is beautiful beyond compare, located right on the beach (literally steps away) and having two enormous, clean pools that are perfect for lap swimming or simply relaxing. Some of the rooms have direct access to the pool. All provide complimentary soft drinks and incredible showers. The entire resort is always impeccably clean. The gym contains enough equipment for a good workout.
reviews.title: 100% wonderful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort is also a mere block from the intense nightlife of Patong so one need not go far for this experience.
reviews.title: La Flora

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is elaborate and sumptuous. Any and every type of breakfast food imaginable. I especially enjoyed the very exotic fruits available, such as sala, rose apple and dragon fruit.
reviews.title: Could improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: La Flora ( LF ) is a member of the Small Luxury Hotels group. We were prepared for Patong as a town so we decided to go as near to ‘’ off season ‘’ as we dare. My first worry was when we pulled up outside the hotel. It’s literally on the main drag. No big lobby. Literally an entrance in between Starbucks and McDonalds ! We were greeted by security staff ( again worrying ) and the guys at the reception came out to meet us. My first gut feel was…’’this is not good’’ …but trust me…this was the one and only time I felt this in the week we were there. All the staff are execptional ! Kind, polite , attentive , well-mannered and couldn’t have gone out of their way more. Even in the face of some rather rude Russian ( shock horror ) and Middle Eastern guests…it never fazed them. Check in was smooth and quick. The room was huge. Very modern, clean and with ALL amenities. From beach towels to scented candles. No immediate complaints and non from then on re room . As far as location is concerned LF is one of the few hotels that is based on the beach. Most hotels you have to cross the road! Lovely clean pools….great poolside service… comfy sunbeds…clean well groomed gardens…and again plenty of security to stop and wanderers from the beach ! The beach was great but I had to remind myself it was at the end the brink of the rainy season. So hard to gaugehow busy it is in the height. We were told from the locals that at the height you cant move…both on the beach and streets. So be aware. Breakfast was good and plentiful. We never ate there in the evenings so can’t comment. The roof top sunset bar is brilliant. I heard the spa was good but then again we never went. Staff are at hand to recommend trips , restaurants and attractions. However it was available cheaper outside the hotel. Considering the location I never experienced any noise from the street. As you walk outside the main entrance you literally ARE right in the middle of EVERYTHING ! so no problems re that. All excursions pick you up at the hotel. Some great restaurants about if you want to eat away from the Riff Raff. If you have booked Patong as a location you should know what to expect ! It’s party town and ANYTHING goes. You can escape this at La Flora ! Would I go back to Patong ?....I dunno … Would I go back to La Flora ? … Yes.!! But you cant do one without the other ! But if you do go to LF I cant recommend it highly enough !
reviews.title: In the den of iniquity which is Patong....it's Heaven

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apologies for posting on the hotel page, but the restaurant doesn’t exist on Tripadvisor, and since it is in your hotel, your readers should know.
reviews.title: The Current of the Sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a terrible experience eating at the Current! We ordered a very expensive sea food platter, which had a lobster, fish, crab, octopus and mussels. Along with that we also ordered red curry duck, with rice, and finished it off with a mango with sticky rice.
reviews.title: Found our new place to stay in Patong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The presentation of the food coming in was fantastic, everything looked very appetizing. The red curry duck was very good.
reviews.title: Lovely, except for the hard beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grilled potatoes were not cooked well, it was almost raw inside. At that moment I wondered if the rest of the grilled items were going to be so bad.
reviews.title: Great location but expensive

aka: La Flora Resort Patong Hotel Patong
description: La Flora Resort Patong…Beachfront bliss embraces at your stay…Discover contemporary design, only a step to the beach, features truly relaxing Pool Villa, Pool Access, Surface Bar with panoramic views and indulge yourself throughout lifestyle entertainment in tropical paradise on Patong Beach. Just steps away from the pristine white sands of Phuket’s finest beach.
